alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 10:34AM MST until February 22 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH THE AFTERNOON IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations between 10 and 20 inches at Lookout Pass, 3 to 6 inches in the valleys. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...St. Maries, Wallace, Dobson Pass, Kellogg, Mullan, Fernwood, Fourth Of July Pass, Lookout Pass, Osburn, and Pinehurst. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
